The owner was clearly overwhelmed today on 4 July  with a visiting team of athletes, but he still made a huge effort to take care of everyone. One of our dishes was delayed by about an hour, but he was upfront about it and kindly comped it. That level of hospitality is rare.

The space is no-frills‚Äîa classic hole-in-the-wall‚Äîbut the food and the owner‚Äôs warmth more than make up for it. If you‚Äôre looking for East African food and genuine service, this place is well worth a visit.

In the picture is $15 of fantastic African food! The chef/owner was above and beyond making sure everything was in order. Also wanted feedback on the food to know what he could do better. I'm not a local, but if I where, I'd definitely come back!

Food was absolutely incredible. Exceeded my expectations completely. All the meat was perfectly cooked and spiced, and the different breads - ugali, malawah, njeera. Our waiter was so friendly and we let him choose what to order us because we wanted to try an authentic Somali family style meal, and it could not have come out more perfect. The sambusas, and guava and vimto juices were awesome too. Highly recommend coming here for a delicious meal, especially if you have never tried East African food before (like us).
The food was SO good! We got the potato leaf and jallof rice. She even let me sample the cassava leaf and potato leaf before I decided. Grace is so nice!

I've seen different ratings from different food servicing platforms and wanted to try it out myself because it was the closest to me. I was pretty disappointed. I ordered the egusi soup with pounded yam 24 oz for $28.99 with extra pepper for $1. First thing I noticed was I did not get my extra pepper kala. It was $1 so, whatever. Food looked good but my first bite in was lacking a lot of flavor. It was bland and almost tasted a little bitter. Curious about the bitterness, I poked around and can see what it looks like to be burnt bottom pieces? For the meat, I can see that its all bony stewing hen pieces. Possibly the worst meat to eat as they are tougher and dryer with littlw to no meat. I wanted to like it but have to admit, this was the worst egusi soup I've had. I've had better egusi soup that came out of a 10oz container with no meat at all and was satisfied with the affordable price. For almost $30, it is not worth it. I'd tip extra to have my food delivered from outside of the area.
Such a delightful and tasty spot! Super friendly staff, expertly seasoned and freshly fried chicken, and cozy jollof rice. Warm smiles and hot food, will definitely be coming back here ü•∞

I love the food, I called in about 9pm about to Close, after I called in and she waited on me, when she was about to leave, great place over hands down., services was great.  Great food. The food is cook fresh and ready. I will recommend this place by any time when you get to Minneapolis check it out.
She was so nice and made sure it was up to par. She let me check the food to take sure it was the correct. The food tasted amazing and made fresh

Stopped in for the first time to order some authentic African food and I got it! I've been looking forward to trying Egusi and fufu. I ordered soup with 2 fufu, unfortunately they didn't have Samosa or Greens today but that's okay, another reason to come back. I ate as much as I could and still have another serving for later. The Egusi soup was perfectly spicy, and made my eyes water.
Food was soo good!! The lady we met was also pleasant. Loved it!

**Toni‚Äôs African Deli: A Flavorful Journey Through Authentic African Cuisine**

If you‚Äôre looking for a place that offers a true taste of African cuisine, look no further than Toni‚Äôs African Deli. My recent visit to this gem left me craving more of its authentic dishes.

I decided to try the **Amala and Ewedu soup with fish and goat meat**, and it was nothing short of amazing. The Amala was soft and smooth, just as it should be, and paired perfectly with the rich, savory Ewedu soup. The flavors were incredibly well-balanced, with the Ewedu bringing that classic, slightly earthy taste that complements the mild, fermented undertone of the Amala.

The goat meat was tender and perfectly seasoned, with just the right amount of spice to give it a flavorful kick. The fish added another layer of deliciousness to the dish, flaky and well-cooked, soaking up the savory goodness of the soup.

Beyond the delicious food, the atmosphere at Toni‚Äôs African Deli is warm and inviting, with a friendly staff that makes you feel right at home. Whether you‚Äôre an aficionado of African cuisine or trying it for the first time, Toni‚Äôs African Deli is a must-visit.

If you‚Äôre in the mood for something truly comforting and hearty, I highly recommend giving Toni‚Äôs African Deli a try. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

OVERPRICED ! I‚Äôm a mom who cooks at home often , and I rarely get takeout because it‚Äôs overpriced and not the most healthiest choice. I HATE wasting my money especially in these times ! Let me say this,  I LOVE African Food and have tried many different restaurants in the cities.  I decided to get dinner here, my first time visiting this place. I paid $20. and some change , for Spinach/rice, they did throw in the ‚Äòhot pepper‚Äô since I guess you have to ask for it and it‚Äôs an additional charge and they only take cash for items under $5.,  I didn‚Äôt know you had to ask , I just thought about it from experiences at other establishments and then wondered if it came with it, ok fine. Moving on to the food, the spinach bowl was small for $20. in my opinion, I mean who‚Äôs counting the rice , its rice and I got plenty of that, you‚Äôd think it would be the other way around. There were 3 medium size pieces of meat that pretty much overpowered the whole bowl of spinach with regards to size , I think the amount of spinach had to be no more than a ice cream scoop and unfortunately it was super oily and bland, NO flavor , just heavy on the grease and chewy meat with a splash of red sauce on top which was spicy. My stomach is bubbling right now !! Unfortunately after about 3 try‚Äôs , I couldn‚Äôt take another bite and my kids didn‚Äôt want any, so I had to cook anyway !!! I‚Äôm so frustrated with restaurants playing in my face! I think the restaurant should take some time and reevaluate their recipes and  the overall flavor if they feel that they deserve what they‚Äôre charging, and try ASKING customers if they‚Äôd like to add a side of pepper or let them know the food is already spicy  !!! Gee wiz simple customer service goes a long way to see to it that your customers are prepared especially for culturally made dishes. You don‚Äôt know who‚Äôs walking in that door. Honestly I‚Äôd be happy with the price only if the food was good and worth it, it‚Äôs possible (I‚Äôve been to plenty upscale restaurants who upcharge for great tasting small portions) I won‚Äôt be back until the reviews are at 5 stars, becausw then I‚Äôll know someone listened and took some of this feedback as an opportunity, but meanwhile I wouldn‚Äôt recommend!!

I ordered through Uber eats and it was the Egusi with goat meat with extra meat and fufu. I was a little off put because the meat was really tough and rubbery. The portion size was much smaller than expected as well. I am willing to give a second chance because I know things happen and I hope when I go in person things are better.

I ordered the cassava leaf and it was not good at all. I couldn‚Äôt even force myself to continue to eat it. Not what I was expecting at all and I asked for beef and smoked turkey but I got smoked turkey and chicken. I would not spend my money here again. If you want good African food..go to African deli on Brooklyn blvd and it‚Äôs cheaper there ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
The food was amazing, it tasted like a home cooked meal and the owner and staff were very nice! 10/10!
The food is so sumptuous.. I would come here over and over again and would also recommend this place to anyone. I give them 5 star.
Very good food. Please patronize them

Well I have offically tried egusi soup and Fufu. Omg! How I've been missing out. It's sooo good.I went to a new place I've never been to get this and I am very pleased. Along with them being so willing to serve me with me not realizing they were closing in like 30 mins.
Thank you for a wonderful experience and delicious dish. I will definitely be coming back.

Great service, great food and absolutely great people!

I went in and immediately I was offered free samples to see what I'd like. Good thing that was offered because I went for a different dish than I would of tried.

Very generous portions indeed. Next time I'm in Minneapolis I'll try something else from here.
Good seasoned food, great atmosphere. I really recommend if you like West African food (Gambian and more) or wish to try it. I‚Äôll continue to come back

I‚Äôve ordered delivery several times and have ordered several items: I‚Äôm telling you, this place doesn‚Äôt miss. Fufu and collards are rich, warm, and comforting with pieces of chicken and smoked pork - absolutely divine. The oxtails are perfectly cooked, falling apart, and simmered in a velvety sauce with chunks of potato and pepper that taste like they‚Äôve stewed with the unctuous meat all day long. The sambusas are filled with meat; the wrapper light, flakey, and crisp without being heavy or oily. Get some of their hot sauce on the side- it‚Äôs great for dipping, adding to any food on the menu, or saving in your fridge to use as a condiment for literally anything else you eat. And the portions are huge! I get three or four meals out of each entree. Blow this place up! They deserve every ounce of praise they get- it‚Äôs no frills but some of the best food in the city right now.

I‚Äôve been here twice now and they are welcoming every time.  I really love their plantains & the special sauce they have for it. I was nervous to try the sauce but I love it ‚ù§Ô∏è

It feels nice finally getting good African food close by ü´∂üèæ
The collards and fufu were 10/10, as was the sambusa. So warm, comforting, and delicious!

The steak suqaar was amazing. The chicken KK was too bit bland and sweet for me. A half size plate is still really big and filling! They gave us bananas for free as an appetizer which was super nice! The staff was so nice and we got everything despite our language barrier. Would 1000% recommend for the suqaar!

Wanted to try something new. Walked into a "local" bonding, hole-in-wall vibe restaurant. Had no idea what any of the items on menu were. Staff explained what dishes consisted of. Went with the KK with chicken. Was able to sit and pay later. They brought food to our table and gave complimentary cokes and waters for us. Staff said they wanted us to "have a good experience and come back". I absolutely loved the food and we cleaned the plate fast! Also, they did not force a tip after paying. Definitely go! And experience amazing hospitality and great food
The food was amazing! If you‚Äôre a fan of trying different ethnic foods, I recommend you come here.
Authentic and the best Somalian food in town. A must try. Exquisite food.

One of the worst Somali restaurants in the area please avoid this place especially to order on Uber eats or any kind of delivery they don‚Äôt care about your order and they won‚Äôt answer your calls unprofessional people

Such amazing service.  They are amazing chefs. So glad they have a business here. I love the Ewedu soup absolutely amazing the flavor is so good. Literally my favorite food.  Amazing fufu  the soup is delicious.  ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Great owner, I‚Äôve known him since he was over on University by Earths beauty supply. He always makes me feel like I‚Äôm talking to a family friend. The food was amazing and made in a timely manner. I wish he did have more grocery but that will come with time. üôåüèæ

Stopped in for some soups and was not disappointed! We tried the efo riro and egusi. Both with fufu. The flavors were amazing, though I might ask for a bit more heat next time. Egusi is one of my favorites, and they nailed it. The guy taking orders was also very friendly and made us feel welcome. I'm so excited to finally have good West African food in St. Paul! If you're in the mood for something amazing, definitely check this place out.
Their African foods are delicious! The Afang is superb üëå! Love everything they have in there. Love their services! Friendly people.

I was excited to see a west africian resturant within reasonable driving distance from our house. Best freaking egusi soup I have ever had. There has been some places where their soup is a bit too earthy or slightly bitter. BUT THIS WAS IN ITS OWN LEAGUE. Perfect balance of comfort, savory, and freshness. The guy working there was very chill and nice. The future and funded yam portions that we got was almost twice the amount of what you usually get from other places. But I mean that in a positive way. Worth the price imo. Definitely will be stopping there more for their food.

Overall, the food was worth the visit. The Key Wot was delicious, bit the other dishes were a little lackluster.
The place felt just a little bit better than almost clean, whereas the bathroom felt like it needed some work.

It was completely empty when I went to lunch on a Tuesday, which I felt was odd, but maybe Tuesday is just their slow day.

I would probably go back again and try other dishes, given I have enough time.

My husband and I recently had the pleasure of dining here, and we were impressed by the food and overall experience. The highlight of my meal was the lamb tibs and the vegetarian platter.

The lamb tibs were cooked to perfection‚Äîtender and juicy, with just the right amount of spice to give it a flavorful kick. The seasoning was rich and aromatic, making each bite a delightful experience.

The vegetarian platter was a feast for veggie lovers like us. It included a variety of vegetable stews, lentils, and other delightful plant-based dishes. Each item was distinct in taste and texture. The portion size was generous, and the dish was served with injera, a soft and spongy flatbread.

The restaurant itself had a warm and inviting atmosphere, with friendly staff and a cozy ambiance. The service was prompt and attentive, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. Overall, I highly recommend this Ethiopian restaurant for anyone looking to enjoy delicious, authentic cuisine.

Wonderful. Menu gave good descriptions. For a table of four we ordered 2 beef, one lamb, and one chicken dish and the bargain priced, $14.95 6 vegetable dish sampler. Honestly, we should have just gotten two meats and the veggie platter. The portions are HUGE. (none of us are small, or light eaters.) Everyone was friendly, but we did not get water refills or the coffee we ordered. Super clean, lovely music, definite A.
Great healthy and delicious food with very kind service.
My dish wasn't as hearty as the lamb tips. Too soapy. It's was good. Great atmosphere. Very clean restaurant & good music.

I never that the original African foods are still cook since I left Africa until I came across this place. The owner is young but she has skills in cooking. The service is great. I love eating there. I don't want to say recommend. But go there if you don't like anything she cook, I personally will refund you. My name is LG. No joke good food

Stopped here after flying into Philadelphia airport and convincing my parents it was a good idea to try African food, which I really enjoy. This area is residential and although I mistaken thought the address next door was the business, was told quite abruptly that I wasn't welcome.

I'm not sure if Minchgirl is catering or what but frankly, I'm happy to have survived the experience and I mean that literally.

This is absolutely the very best place to be. This is what I call Africa in America, a home far from home when it comes to African (Liberian) variety of dishes and sealed with very good customer service. At Minchgirl Restaurant, customer satisfaction is number 1!!!!
They have the best homemade Liberian dish in southwest philly. FYI: they don't accept credit or debit cards. Cash and cashapp only.
I was intrigued by how delicious this dry rice taste. I 100/10% recommend this dry-rice! The best liberian üá±üá∑ Dry-rice I have ever had.

This is my first time trying Senegalese food. I got the lamb dibi with jollof and plantain. I spent around $23. The portion was fine. The lamb was delicious, and a hint of mustard. The plantain was very sweet, just a tad too greasy for my liking. The rice was my least favorite. Maybe it was the type of rice they used, I didn‚Äôt like the texture, it also didn‚Äôt have that much flavor.

First time having Senegalese food -- but not the last! Got a dish called Yassa -- chicken, flavorful cooked onions, and rice. Amazing flavor. Also got a super fresh salad to start, and a really flavorful coffee. Constant flow of people coming in or taking out, so obviously a neighborhood gem I was missing out on. Staff was super nice too. Coming back for the lamb next time!

We decided to dine in, and I have to say this place blew me away. From the start, the service was warm and welcoming. They brought out complimentary coffee and donuts, which were absolutely delicious and set the tone for the meal. When the food arrived, I had the Yassa with fish‚Äîand wow, it was hands down one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in a long time. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Between the incredible food, the amazing coffee, and the top-notch service, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

New Senegalese restaurant!! Food is truly authentic! Price is affordable and good quantity! Order ahaead for take out, it can take 15 to 20 minutes to get a meal done! Natural ginger and hibiscus, nicely flavored! Definitely recommend if you are looking for a real Senegalese dish!! Will go back!!

Let‚Äôs normalize leaving honest reviews for these ‚Äúviral‚Äù restaurants. I waited an hour for the lamb dibi and jollof which would have been fine had I got more meat than bones. Might have been 2 small boneless bites the rest was bones and onions that were so spicy I couldn‚Äôt even finish for $20. The jollof was also very spicy which I‚Äôve never experienced in the past. I can deal with some heat but it was way too spicy to really enjoy. Atleast mark the items on the menu that are spicy with a realistic level system. Not many options in the area for African food maybe I‚Äôll return and try something else.. maybe not but this is my honest review.

I was in PA and wanted some authentic Nigerian food. I found this resturant and decided to give it a try the food was great very flavorful and great portions. Price was also reasonable plenty parking. I would most definitely say if you are in the area to stop by and give it a try! The resturant is on the second floor inside SA Cafe!

amazing food and service! will definitely be back. the restaurant is tucked away on the second floor and we almost thought we were in the wrong place - so glad we still stopped in because the food was delicious. we got the suya, egusi soup, and jollof rice with bone in lamb, and i would highly recommend each dish. the portion sizes were very generous and the service was great.
The food was amazing. The lamb may have been the best I have ever had. Jolof rice was also delicious. I‚Äôll definitely go back again.
We were looking for Nigerian food around the area and we normally stop by in center City but this restaurant looks good it look clean so we decided to give it a try
Great food, portions and service!

name: Eatwell Philly - African Restaurant and Lounge

reviews.text: Everything felt incredibly authentic and well done! The waitress helped up go through the menu and choose things that interest us without ordering in excess. I personally like my fufu on the side and not under everything. Some of the meats just weren‚Äôt my cup of tea but i‚Äôm sure others will like it. We recommend the Suya

Stopped into Eatwell for lunch and had a great experience! The food was fantastic, particularly the spicy suya, meat pies, and jollof rice. The menu was quite extensive, so there are plenty of options and we look forward to trying new things. It was our first time eating here, but the service was pleasant and helpful in explaining things on the menu. Overall, a great time!

The lady who helped me(the owner i assume). Was very nice! Very patient & polite. Food took a while to come out(I ordered takeout). The food was good overall, very flavorful & spicy for those who can‚Äôt handle spice.
Portion size is so good! I think I‚Äôll have this food for just about a week & the price was well worth it.

I was walking when I spotted this place. I was excited to check it out as I am African and wanted to support an African restaurant. The Suya was a little dry to me, but I did still enjoy it. The puff puff was definitely worth it. The restaurant was clean and it wasn't too loud. I definitely recommend checking them out.

I was traveling to Delaware from Las Vegas through the Philadelphia international airport. I craved for authentic Nigerian meal. I googled and this restaurant popped up. From the door, to the table, the atmosphere felt like home away from home. I ordered goat meat pepper soup (100% tasty with organic spices). I ordered amala (60%) - the ewedu (jute leaves) was not green enough for me. I ordered the ayamase (peppered fried stew) to go. They all tasted delicious. I will be going back there. My server was polite, and professional. Their bathroom was clean, and well decorated. Overall, I was impressed.

I love it here! Someone told me about Emma‚Äôs which is close by, I went and they were so rude, the place stunk and everything so I took my business elsewhere where, good this place which was near by AND IVE BEEN EATING HERE EVERY SINCE!!! FROM THE TIME I CAME IN THEY WERE SO WELCOMING, PATIENT, ANSWERED QUESTIONS FOR ME AND MY FAMILY, GAVE RECOMMENDATIONS, AND TOLD ME CALL AHEAD OF TIME IF I HAD ANY SPECIAL REQUEST!!!! PLEASE GO NOW!! THE DRY RICE AND SNAPPER IS MY FAVORITE!! THE FUFU & SOUP IS MY FAVORITE!!!!!
Best dry rice and fish in the city. The grill food is amazing. The family is always courteous and nice to everyone.
She is the Best in SouthWest! Top Tier African Cuisineüòã
Kabobs always a hit I go twice a  week in the summer
You‚Äôre phone number is not going through

Ordered delivery and the food did not disappoint. Everything was delicious. This was the lamb with jollof rice, side of plantain and side of cabbage. The cabbage i wasn‚Äôt crazy about (too soft no crunch) but everything else was very good and would order again. They give you plenty of food. I believe the prices are fair for the amount of food you receive.

First time at this location, Peanut butter soup A1. Not an overpowering peanut taste, gravy is savory seasoned just rite, white rice cook to perfection I Will be back. Called in still had a little wait 5-10 mins. But well worth it.

Le Mandingue African Restaurant has very professional staff members that have great customer service skills and the food is good and high quality for the price that you pay,on my opinion. Keep up the good work üëç
I ordered on DoorDash yesterday and received molded potato greens! I am disgusted and really upset. I have supported for years and have only spoke highly about the business. Never again!

Fufu is like rice dough with yam mashed in with no flavor... and the egusi spinach chicken tastes like burnt plastic with no aromatic fragrance at all... I will try the lamb next and will update... I do not recommend the above dishes for beginners....

Were do I begin! I have restaurants that I believe are good to very good. I thought this restaurant was exceptional! So Let‚Äôs Dish! Customer Service was patient and informative as this was our first time in a West African restaurant. He did everything with a generous smile. The place where they were cooking was clean and organized. Now the food, clean, wonderful spices, and plentiful! The vegetables tasted like they were made in heaven! The plantains were a perfect sweet but not too sweet balance. Rice cooked perfectly. And my friend ate all the cornbread üò±.  I can‚Äôt wait to go try everything on the menu. The steak was slightly over cooked but the seasoning was on point. Run don‚Äôt walk to this place!
My fianc√© has been dying to try some egusi and fufu and it did not disappoint. I got a chicken suya bowl and everything was delicious and fresh.
Best West African food I've ever had!! Hidden gem alert! Highly recommend trying out their amazing African food. They have so many options!! You will love every bite of your food!!‚ù§Ô∏è

First time having African food! Omg this is so good and flavorful - love the sauces red and white ! The cashier was super nice as well.
Love it!
I love their chicken wrap. I eat here twice a week usually and the food is great and they‚Äôre so friendly really nice people a little bit spicy so if you like spice, you‚Äôll definitely enjoy it.

Aunty K‚Äôs fried rice and mackerel were really good! You can taste the pepper and it was a lot of food. To my pleasant surprise it came with fried sweet plantains and a very spicy pepper sauce (use with caution). The lady at the counter was polite and i waited and watched their tv as they prepared my food.

During my recent visit to Aunty K's West African Restaurant, I had a great experience. The restaurant was clean and well-maintained, with a few tables and chairs for customers to dine in. The daily menu and prices were displayed on chalkboards behind the counter, making it easy to decide what to order.

The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Sidique came out from behind the counter to greet me, which made me feel welcomed.

Although my favorite cassava leaf soup was unavailable on this visit, Sidique assured me it would be back on the menu soon. As an alternative, I decided to try the Peanut Butter Soup.

The Peanut Butter Soup was delicious. Its savory taste balanced the slight sweetness of the peanut butter. The soup was rich and hearty, with stew chicken and beef. It was served with a generous portion of white rice. They also provided a small container of hot pepper sauce on the side, allowing me to customize the heat level.

Overall, Aunty K's West African Restaurant is a clean and friendly establishment with tasty food. I look forward to returning soon.
Picked up to go. Sooo good . First time trying acheke + for the price lasted me at least 2 meals

Had a good time eating at this African restaurant for the first time, Food was good and the ambiance was excellent. Customer service by the owner was great. We had dry rice and beef. I will recommend anyone who wants to try a taste.
Food was amazing. I got the fried mackerel and jollof rice. I have been craving it ever since.

I ordered online, and my food arrived fresh and hot, which I really appreciated.

I tried the Beef Suya (spicy) platter with plantain, cabbage, onion, and jollof rice. The jollof rice was definitely the best part it was flavorful and perfectly cooked. The beef Suya was tender with a nice texture and good spice, though I found it a bit too salty. I have a high spice tolerance, but even for me the heat built up and made it tough to finish, so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone sensitive to spice.

Portion-wise, I wish there had been more plantain and onion, as the serving felt small compared to the generous amount of rice.

I also ordered a chicken Suya leg on the side, and in my opinion, the chicken Suya was much better than the beef.

This African spot is amazing! Definitely try the Suya bowl because it‚Äôs a great deal and packed with flavor. Some of the dishes were spicy even at the lowest spice level, so watch out if you‚Äôre not big on heat. You HAVE to get the cornbread as a side. It‚Äôs seriously so good. Loved everything about this place and will definitely be back. Seems like it‚Äôs easier to dine in and let the food come out when it ready instead of ordering online.

This food is like, heaven to me!  An old friend introduced it to me‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs honestly the best food I‚Äôve ever eaten before. The food tastes like it was made with love and care. Also, the customer service was incredible! They‚Äôre extremely friendly and helpful! PLEASE PLEASE ‚Äî add additional fans or AC units for the employees. I was waiting for my food and I was sweating so much, I could only imagine what the employees must feel being.

Located in northern liberties, so parking can be a challenge. I wanted to like this food. The price isn‚Äôt awful, but it‚Äôs not the great either. I paid about $15 for the steak bowl with jollof and plantain, and then another $4 for a meat pie. Everything was lackluster. The meat pie ingredients tasted muddled, I did enjoy the crust tho. The jollof rice flavor was mild, I wish it stood out more‚Ä¶ as in more tomato taste, more richness‚Ä¶ anything to resemble Nigerian jollof. The steak suya was fine‚Ä¶ it was a bit tough, and majority of the flavor came from the sprinkled suya spice over top. The plantain was light skin and hard and they weren‚Äôt very sweet. I‚Äôve been meaning to try the restaurant and I finally did. I‚Äôm not impressed.

I came about an hour before closing and ordered a shrimp suya bowl with a side of plantain and broccoli. While I loved the rice and the white sauce, the broccoli and shrimp were almost inedible. The broccoli tasted really old and mushy, and it was really over seasoned. The shrimp was cooked well but it was also heavily over seasoned so I couldn‚Äôt really enjoy it. I‚Äôd try this place again earlier in the day, maybe the quality would be better, but only the jollof rice was really up to my expectations (I‚Äôm West African)

name: Le Mandingue African Restaurant Upper Darby

reviews.text: The food is very good and stays consistent. The service leaves LOTS to desire. It's extremely slow. The food is not ready when promised. The one young girl who does the register is VERY unprofessional. She holds phone conversations on speakerphone using language not appropriate for a business setting. The men I've encountered are very polite, professional and courteous. I hope they make necessary improvements.

Although being cold inside and having food boxes and tools all over the place when I came in, I refuse to give lower than 4 stars because I thoroughly enjoyed the food. The Jollof, Red Snapper, and Potato Greens were really great. I‚Äôd definitely get more of their food, but only for take out.

This place has completely fallen off, I ordered food from here several times in the past but my last two experiences have been horrible. Today 12/7/24 I ordered palava Sauce and my dish was very dry with no taste, no flavor and so sauce. They typically put different types of meat in sauce but today was only chicken. My rice was extremely overcooked and very mushy. It was so bad that I couldn‚Äôt bring myself to eat any of it. I will never come here again.

So I literally just ordered off a DoorDash. I only ordered red snapper and rice. I did not get red snapper and the rice is burnt. I don‚Äôt know why they would even sell this rice. I did not even want order from here. I wanted to order from small pot, but it was too far from my house. I tried to give them a chance but what I‚Äôm noticing is a lot of African restaurants think Americans are stupid and you ask for one type of fish and they give you a whole different type of fish. This is kingfish. I asked for red snapper and I paid for red snapper its total difference in price. How can you mess up on rice? I could‚Äôve made this rice in my sleep and don‚Äôt worry next time I will make my own food.

I ordered from this restaurant on Uber Eats and ran into a few hiccups with my order ‚Äî but the staff went above and beyond to help me out. I had to call back multiple times (three in total!), and each time they answered with patience and kindness, never once sounding irritated. A special thank you to Kaba for personally helping me fix everything ‚Äî your customer service was outstanding.

As for the food‚Ä¶ absolutely delicious! I had the palm butter soup and pepper soup with grilled goat meat, and every bite was full of flavor. I‚Äôll definitely be ordering again.

Customer service is completely awful. I asked the lady at the front about a dish and she yelled at me saying, if you don‚Äôt know it don‚Äôt try it. If this restaurant wants to survive, please remove her from the front, she has horrible customer service.  She also said ‚Äúwhat type of questions is that‚Äù I‚Äôm confused, if you‚Äôre running a food business aren‚Äôt you supposed to have capacity to answer questions about your menu? To make matters worse, it was only 1 other person in the restaurant so it‚Äôs not like she didn‚Äôt have time. I left without even ordering because I don‚Äôt trust people like that making food I can‚Äôt see them making. People make sure you know exactly what you want
Food portions are huge! I was quite surprised. The jollof rice and chicken was okay. It could have been a little more flavorful. The soup was freaking delicious! Must get with fish.

Authentic & Fresh Nigerian food. Most orders are made from scratch so I recommend calling ahead to place an order to allow time for preparation. And especially for Moi-Moi, call early before they are sold out for the day. They never disappoint when I'm craving Nigerian food. üòã

Was my 1st time ever trying this type of food. I had the Egusi Soup and chicken with rice.  The food was decent but I still have yet to compare it to  Others. I can say that the chicken and rice was very savory The only problem was that they literally gave me about 8 cups of rice with with 2 or three bite size pieces of chicken Very unproportioned. Other than that the food was actually very delicious
The Nigerian food tasted nice.  I ordered the jollof rice with plantain and assorted meat. I truly enjoyed my meal. Although the eating  environment could use a little upgrade.

JD African Restaurant has great food and the food is prepared with care. I went into the restaurant with my mom buying food to ship to Florida. That's how good JD's food is. Apparently, Florida doesn't have African Food but we specifically go to JD then anywhere else in the area. Keep up the good work üëç

The food is tasty but the platter is half empty. Why are you not putting the right amount of food in the bowl? I got cassava leaf two times in one week. The first time I gave a pass because it was later in the day but the second time I came as soon as they open and same thing. A small serving. The bowl not even filled to the top. Barely half way. Mainly unknown pieces of meat. Really no cassava. Very disappointing because the flavor is good. Tsk. Side note the guy that takes my order isn‚Äôt very welcoming at all.

I absolutely love the greens and rice that this restaurant serves it is very well seasoned with a hint of spiciness. It comes with a side of sweet cornbread.

The portion size is also good, but I‚Äôve eaten half of what you see in the picture but you get more than enough rice.

There are lots of fresh juices and carbonated drinks. They only take CASH!

Been loyal to this spot for 4 years I even moved away and still make sure this is my first stop after the airport when i need to get my grub on. Best African food I ever had hands down I need him to move out Houston so I go back to eating his food every week (no exaggeration I was eating it once a week)

the costumer service is üëéüèΩ . Its my first time going there and i was waiting up front for someone to take my order and they were all in the back talking very loud and getting dress ??. The food was good but they are very rude to Americans .

Got tired of mandingue bad customer service. I gave this pace a shot and I am not disappointed. Attieke was fresh and delicious. Meat flavorful. Customer service great. I ordered over the phone when I got there my food was ready. I just wish the meat had some onion sauce to it. Other than that love it . Thank you

If you‚Äôve never had African food before you‚Äôll probably enjoy this place. If you have, just skip it. It‚Äôs not bad but since it‚Äôs in an area with lots of African restaurants it doesn‚Äôt hold up to the competition in the area. Emma‚Äôs is a few blocks away and sooo much better. We tried the palava sauce and the pepper soup. It was not as spicy as most West African food tends to be but came with pepper sauce on the side to turn the heat up. The food had a good flavor but it wasn‚Äôt cooked long enough for the flavor to really get into the meat & bones. The cow foot was very tough and the fish in the soup was underdone. The fufu was not mixed well. It was edible but I was disappointed knowing I could have gone somewhere else nearby for much better food. Also, The bathroom smelled horribly and when I asked for soap I was informed they had none so I had to help myself to the dish detergent sitting just outside the bathroom.

The grilled fish and Achekeh was one of the best I have had in a long time. The fish was seasoned and well done and  the achekeh was not dry like other places lol. I will be coming back again for grilled fish
Authentic and delicious Liberian food. Big portions. Very good prices

(8/18/23) I unfortunately had to change my review. The young woman was going to send me off with old, nasty looking plantains until I mentioned who I was in relation to my husband (who is African and known to them), so she made new plantains and put them on top of the old ones. I was also upcharged (I questioned it and it was a sudden "change in price"). I believe in fairness across the board, and me not being born on the continent shouldn't mean I should get lower quality food.
.....
(3 years ago)
Their fish & plantains is pretty good. I was introduced to the meal by a friend and I have gotten hooked. The only thing is the price changes if you get the same thing one week versus another. It's a bit pricey, but there's probably a good reason for it. Overall, the meal is good with caramelized onions and mayo with vegetables.

I am visiting Philly and I was looking for a Nigerian restaurant. I ordered online via DoorDash and the food was good. The jollof rice tastes nice. The gizzard dodo is equally nice but they had less gizzard and more dodo. The ponmo is soft and spicy. ü•µ

I ordered assorted meat, but they gave me ponmo and beef. Ponmo and beef is not assorted. That was my only concern. Please don‚Äôt sell ponmo and beef as assorted üåö

I recently had the pleasure of dining at fork n fingers, and I was thoroughly impressed by the quality and flavor of the dishes. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and our server was attentive and knowledgeable throughout the meal.

The food was very tasty full of flavor. Suya tasted like it was definitely re-heated‚Ä¶ The food was not spicy at all made to cater to all taste buds. I would say if you are in the area give it a try there is a bit of wait for the food to be ready so call in ahead.

The food quality is good and, at the very least, more consistent than the previous owner meals. However, the prices are quite high. The portion sizes are disappointingly small‚Äîmore suitable for children. They could definitely do better, as no adult African would feel satisfied with a single dinner meal. You‚Äôd need to combine multiple portions just to feel full. Overall, a very poor experience.

Out of all the African/Nigerian restaurants I have tried in Philly/Delaware, this one was the best. First of all the food was very tasty and reasonably priced. I have been here 3 times. First time, I had fried rice and puff puff. 10/10. The second time I had ogbono soup. Very tasty although there was no spinach or any type of greens. My other compalint would be that i ordered hard chicken and it was just a little too hard. It was still good tho. 8/10. The 3rd time I had egusi. Very tasty and on point. 10/10.

The portion size was also very decent. You get a nice bang for your buck. The service was good. Food didn't take forever and the lady at the counter was sweet, friendly ans informative

Cons: The menu isn't very accurate because it didn't not that certain meats had a small unchanrge which I found annoying.

Also, not their fault, but the surrounding area is in not that nice looking of a location but honestly when you go inside, the place looks decent.

Overall, I'd say this place is great and highly recommended if your looking for some good Nigerian or Ghanaian food

name: Mama D Nigerian Catering, Cuisine, and Events

reviews.text: I enjoyed every bits of this meal, a wonderful customer service alongside a fresh meal
One of the best amala I have ever tasted.The servers are very kind and patient I will definitely order again!!!!!!
Mama D is the best caterer of our time,delicious food, professional,friendly staff, and smooth service.
Good food choices, affordable and authentic. Highly recommend trying!!!
Love Mama D!! Delicious food and really well organized for events.
I had their beef kabobs,and  chicken they were very good
Overpriced basic food. Service too slow.
Good food , love the snapper fish
Yvonis jollof and suya is delicious. i love her refreshers as well. The owner is a very nice along with her employees.

The owner is such a beautiful blessing of a woman‚ô•Ô∏è
I love african cuisine!!! If i dont feel like driving i order from uber eats and i love this place..tonight ubereats mixed up the orders and ihad the wrong food..iwould have ate it but my son doesnt favor fu fu..the owner was very very nice when icalled and since she isnt far from me i decided to go in like she offered bcuz to get the order replaced through uber would have never happened..when iwent in she was so nice to me and my son..she even sent me home with an extra meal..such a beautiful blessing of a Queen‚ô•Ô∏è
I love this place they are nice people and great food. I've been going here for years ! Everything's fresh! And tasty!

I ordered
Potato greens
Cassava leaf
And now egusi . I love their food, it has so much flavor, smoked , peanut butter, and if you like hot it‚Äôs very spicy .

I was craving for fufu and searched on google map for an hour for authentic ones and finally chose this restaurant‚Äî I ordered from Uber eat, keep in mind that you will need to order at least 1-2 hours ahead during prime time because they may get extremely busy.

But their fufu is soooo goooddd üò≠ this is my second time eating fufu and I notice Susanna‚Äôs fufu is so much smoother and homogenized than the first fufu I had at another place. I love both texture and taste tho.

The cassava leaf taste very authentic! I personally like the cassava leaf than the pepper soup that comes with fufu better but it‚Äôs all personal preference. Next time I will order extra fufu!!

Wonderful food Beautiful people!
I wish Susana's Kitchen would please get some cow foot for me please ‚ù§Ô∏è

This place????? It was my first time to order with them and trust me when I say this is the best restaurant if you‚Äôre looking for fufu with soup especially the EGUSSI soup üò©üò©. The portion is amazing and the taste I can‚Äôt describe it!

I got egusi and fufu and it was good! It was oily but I assume that's how it's made. I ordered take out and the food was very hot when I picked it up. I ordered  goat but I was given chicken. I told the chef it was fine as long as I was charged for chicken. It paid $21 total so I thought it was a little pricey just for one meal. The place does not really support dine in as there was about 1 table with 2 seats and AC. I enjoyed. Wish it came with more fufu though. If you want to try African food, this is a good place to try!

Their food is overpriced!! I will stick to the Liberian restaurant. Potatoes green and cassava leaves are mainly a Liberian dish, and they don't cook it right. They told me 25 dollars for some tilapia and plantain, and I was out and never returned.

For $30 I got 1/2 containers of food with 4 small pieces of meat and old sticky clumps of rice! I will never return to this restaurant EVER again!! The goat was so tough even a dog couldn‚Äôt chew it!! Don‚Äôt waste your time or money going there. When I called the restaurant the man said I paid that price for the RAW fufu lol no sir I order the Okra that came with fufu! So where is the rest of my food??? Will be getting my money back ASAP!!

I wish I could put a video in here to actually show what they gave me. Why is my cassava leaf soup? Who ever packed my ordered saw exactly how it was and you guys still gave it to me. It was not cooked properly and it was still served to me.
This is one of my go to spots for Caribbean food, I get the fufu and potato greens so so good
I got egusi with pounded yam (fufu) it's was ok and then I put the pepper sauce in it . That made it really good . Now the atmosphere and customer service definitely could be nicer
Jamaican  food is excellent. Very delicious. Yous who like Jamaican  food will love it
I got the fried snapper with Jollof rice, everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection! Will be going again!
I like her food, it's good. They just need to improve the customer service and how to attend to people.
Awesome

My colleagues and I recently had the pleasure of visiting African Small Pot for the first time and everybody left with a smile. We had many different items from the menu (variety of fish, chicken, rice, greens, etc.) and everything was truly so delicious and flavorful! The entire staff including the chef and the owner were very welcoming and accommodating to us, as we were a large group. We are incredibly grateful! üåü See you again soon!

An absolute 10/10. The customer service was excellent, as well as the food. The owner was extremely attentive and made sure my friend and I were taken care of. I ordered some red snapper, with a side of rice, and some plantain. I will definitely be coming back.

This was my first time here, I came 20 minutes before closing. I ordered fried red snapper, and cassava leaf. The cassava leaf was good, the fried red snapper was nice and fresh the sauce was really good. I will be returning.

Food was great! Definitely recommend the grilled snapper and rice, absolutely delicious.
I typically order to go. I highly recommend that the owner of this restaurant redo the bathroom. Food is great but the atmosphere needs major improvement. I won't recommend dining in, just take out.

This place is a hit or miss but after yesterday I‚Äôm definitely cool off them. I ordered a chicken and rice platter to go. As I was waiting for my food I kept hearing the microwave go off a few times but didn‚Äôt think too much about it. When I got home to eat my food, first of all the chicken was chopped up not knowing what pieces I‚Äôm eating(usually dark meat), it was dry, and you could tell they warmed it up in the microwave. Will not be returning.

My first time eating here . Love the decor very small restaurant only one person to server and cook. The soup with fufu was flavorful , and spicy like I love. Big portions for the price. That was the plus of the restaurant The problem was that they were out of quite a few things I wanted to order with my meal. And I told my family to come purchase some food from here. They told me they order the chicken dinner and didn't get the other items that were supposed to be included with the chicken dinner. But they were still charging the same price instead of at a discount price because it wasn't a full meal as advertised. Now they are upset with me for suggesting this restaurant that cheated them. I'm appalled at why they did that?
The food and the service was amazing! I cannot wait to go back. You must check it out.

I ordered tonight at 8:00pm online off of their website... I called at 9:50 and asked when should i expect my delivery. The guy stated it was taken 20 mins prior and laughed. The place is a 12 min drive (I don't drive). I'm writing this at 10:22 and obviously still no food. They need to check their drivers smh...

The food was AMAZING! We had the jollof rice and plantains and the egusi soup with fufu and it was everything I was looking for. It did not disappoint. I live an hour away and I will take that drive just to eat here again. I‚Äôm so happy I found this place!

The man who claims to be the owner is rude and disrespectful to customers. He also spends more time flirting with women who pass thru than the customer's. Never going back. I will save my money and make my own. The meat is tough and he gives very little vegetable.

It was my first time trying this cuisine so i don‚Äôt know how the food tastes. But the food was okay. The atmosphere in there was not great but the lady working there was genuinely nice. Also they only take cash.

The food here was very good. The owner is super nice  and was adamant about warning me of the spice. I'm jamaican and it did not bother me at all. The inside could use an update, but the food is "bussin." I got the jollof rice and lamb.

If you‚Äôre looking for good Nigerian food, this place is not the right place to order. I wasted $200 ordering platters of jollof, fried rice, moin moin, pepper stew, and egusi. Only the egusi was ok. Everything else wasn‚Äôt good. The moin moin was some greyish color and didn‚Äôt taste like moin moin. Do not waste your money!

Delicious
Very friendly lady that cooks the food
Ordered Fufu and Egusi soup for the first. The food was very tasty. The owner is very nice.

Clean,  chicken and rice was delicious üòã, service was great, doesn't hurt to have beautiful women working there either üòã

Just post a host of pictures,  not related to gulu west African Market.
Love the Authentic West African Food.  Gus & Lulu (hence ‚ÄúGulu‚Äù) are awesome.  The food is delicious, service is wonderful, the Ambiance is Welcoming and Take-Out is Available.

Food was spoiled I've been violently sick since eating spent up to 60 dollars just to be sick.  I can't eat anything or keep it down due to this.  I had to leave work early I've been vomiting and deficating since I've disgusted the food.  First time ever and thought I was going to be good.  The pepper sauce was bad. I called her to let her know she blamed it on an allergic reaction which is not true I've been eating african food for 10 years and never experienced what I've experience. Don't eat her waste of money!!!!

I just paid $15.50 for dry rice and goat.  Basically I paid 15.50 for white rice, some sauce, and goat fat.  After removing the goat fat and skin, I was left with about two tablespoons of edible goat meat.  I'm never coming here again.
Literally my go to spot for anything West African. The food is so delicious and the ladies are very lovely. 5/5 across the board for service, food, and atmosphere

I had the jollof rice with fish. It was so exquisite and flavorful I found myself asking the cook could I take her home. To my disappointment she was on the phone with her husband. Not to mention they served a large portion for just $20. I‚Äôll definitely be back next time I‚Äôm in the area.

Never had African food before so I saw this place and I was excited to try something new. I ordered the rice with lamb and it came with veggies and plantains. Rice and lamb were very good! The plantain was overcooked though I think, which I was disappointed about as I love plantain. Overall very good food
The food is pretty good, flavorful and filling. We got the plaintain fish and dry rice and fish. Definately order ahead of time as they take a bit of time to finish the order. Would go again!
Very good restaurant,  we tried Egusi soup, and it was good. The service is really great. The ladies that were working there were so sweet.

I ordered on the 10:30special when yah hungry but chineses food just isn‚Äôt the move. You want something that‚Äôs gonna touch yah soul and send you on yah way gracefully, the peanut butter soup with fufu did just that.  By the time I realized I needed to write the review the food was gone sorry no picsü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

name: Mama Shan's African and Soul Food Cuisine

html_attributions: Mama Shan's African and Soul Food Cuisine

reviews.text: I‚Äôm very disappointed in his restaurant. I definitely will never be ordering from this establishment any longer. I don't recommend anyone to order from here. I ordered potato greens & fufu, while eating my food, I pull a piece of metal out of my mouth it poked the side of my tongue. My tongue hurt so bad. I‚Äôm very disappointed and disgusted you‚Äôre not handling food properly. This places is unsanitary, I have never written a review of any business or establishment. I‚Äôm  pissed off.

First & last time ordering from here!!
This stuff definitely been sitting around for god knows how long & they really thought it was okay to package it up & send it to somebody to eat. Not my family‚Ä¶I had to throw it out! Lesson learned I‚Äôll continue to drive to west Philly for my African food!!

I sensed a decline when I ordered previously from Mama Shan‚Äôs but today absolutely takes the cake. I ordered a large curry goat platter with jolloff rice, plantains and mac & cheese. The Mac cheese is wet, crumbly and sour. It tastes and looks as if it spoiled and was later reheated. The large platter came with three pieces salty protein that are mostly fat and bone. The only edible part of the platter is the side of plantains. Throwing this in the garbage, as we speak. Waste of money!

These people are scam artist. They tell you that they‚Äôre giving you red snapper and then give you tilapia. they also make you pay an extra fee for a large piece of red snapper and then turn around and give you a small piece of tilapia. or a small piece of red snapper, but this don‚Äôt look like red snapper to me at all. This is my order from yesterday and this is my order from today and I paid the same exact price. I ordered this the day before and paid the same amount. The proof is in the picture the. They do not take care of our customers and they are scam. Artists they try to get the most out of their book. This was supposed to be a large red snapper they even charge you extra two dollars for a large red snapper and I did not get a large red snapper even if it‚Äôs not tilapia it ain‚Äôt no large
Would not recommend. I didn‚Äôt receive half the items I bought from them on uber eats. The chicken is barely fried. But, pink In the inside

name: Mawa's African Cuisine (Authentic African & American Cuisine)

reviews.text: Authentic, delicious, plentiful, and memorable. This is an outstanding African restaurant with great flavor, value, and distinction. For those in Philly, it's worth the drive! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

A little annoyed bc I literally searched and searched for a new African place to try and thought this would be great but it wasn‚Äôt. Granted, I ordered through DoorDash but still, the quality of the food shouldn‚Äôt differ. I ordered potato greens and fufu bc I‚Äôve never tried potato greens before and got a container that said OKRA and very mushy, clumpy, watery fufu that was like mashed potatoes and impossible to eat my soup with‚Ä¶ Ive never had fufu like before so I‚Äôm very disappointed and don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be ordering from this place again.
The food is by far excellent. If you‚Äôre ever in the Delco area and hungry, Mawa‚Äôs is a must visit!!! The service and atmosphere is absolutely friendly.

Very good. Fufu was fresh and soft. Didn‚Äôt pair well with the potato greens but I just wanted to try something new. The potato greens were very good. I enjoyed this meal for 3days straight. Very full filling and delicious food. I will be back to try there other dishes

üî• MUST-TRYüî•I just had another incredible meal from Jammie‚Äôs Creative Food and I had to leave a review this time! This family-owned local gem serves food that truly tastes like home.

I ordered lamb, plantains, and vegetable rice, and just WOW! The lamb was tender and flavorful, the plantains were perfectly caramelized, and the rice was light, fluffy, and packed with veggies.

You can tell every bite is made with love, passion, and authenticity. Whether you order online or visit in person, you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Support this amazing spot‚Äî10/10 recommend!
Amazing food, friendly staff and welcoming environment. Enjoy coming here for their different types of spicy meats and great carbs(jollof rice, atieke, plantains)

Had an excellent meal here. I ordered the thieboudienne, bissap, baobab juice, and thiakry. Thieboudienne is incredibly delicious, the rice was cooked perfectly and the sauce that the food was cooked in was outstanding. It came with a hot sauce that was also phenomenal. The bissap and baobab juice were great and refreshing accompaniments. Honestly, being able to get baobab juice at all in this region is really impressive. I took the thiakry to go and enjoyed it, its great on a hot summer night and the millet provides a really interesting and nice texture for a dessert.

Service was great and hospitable, and there are many tables available. You can tell they take their food really seriously at this restaurant. Also, I didn‚Äôt get something with fufu but I saw another table get it and the fufu looked massive - definitely got to try that next time.

Best West African food I‚Äôve had in Massachusetts so far.
Fresh food so it‚Äôll be a wait ‚è≥, but it‚Äôs worth the wait! Family run restaurants! I‚Äôd come back!

I ordered Egusi soup, fufu and donuts (puff puff or Mandazi) through Uber Eats. It was delicious, I like that they put the hot sauce on the side so I can add as I like it. I donuts were nice and soft. I enjoyed my meal.
I‚Äôm a fan! We had the Jollof rice and fried fish and it was a 10/10! Sorrel and Ginger juice are addictive. I can‚Äôt wait to go back and explore other things on the menu!

The food was delicious, but I felt like the pricing was not transparent. When I entered, there was no visible menu, and the prices were only displayed on a photo of the menu. I was charged $25 for jaloff rice, four pieces of plantain, and two pieces of beef stew, but according to the Google Maps menu, the price should‚Äôve been $15. I usually pay around $15 or $16 for similar dishes at other places, so this felt overpriced. While the food was tasty, I believe the pricing should be more clear and consistent with what‚Äôs advertised.

Unexceptional Nigerian cuisine. Staff are nice enough, and the restaurant is your typical small scale affair, but the jollof and fried rice I tried were definitely not an exciting taste of Nigerian food, especially compared to the alternatives available in Boston and Worcester. Hopefully the soups will be better.

I paid $60 almost $70 for 2 plates through doordash. The Food was too expensive to be tasting that bad. I got vegetable soup with fufu and some other plate, it smelt like straight fish and tasted like it too. I was so mad I never had Nigerian that tastes that bad. Literally couldn't eat itüò´ and don't get me started on the meat‚Ä¶ you get the worst part and its over cooked.

They might actually have good food. But their service stinks!
Their service was so bad, never got to the food.

Came from Springfield for isi-ewu, called ahead, was assured of it being ready by the time we got there. I‚Äôm parked terribly outside cos I hoped it was grab, pay and go. Left me standing while he talked to another familiar customer, who clearly came right after I walked in.Soup comes so little for the price tag of $32! Tasted ok, oily, more meat would have made my day. Oh well, back home now, all I can is a review. Read reviews‚Ä¶ trust your guts!

Really enjoyed coming here.  Portion sizes are average (not especially large) considering the prices. I really liked the vegetable options, and the lamb was good, better than the beef imo.

Service was fine, ordering was easy through the QR codes, though you can also order up front.

This place looks very unassuming from the outside, but has a cozy area in the back inside. The flavors are delicious and the teas are a must -- either the regular or the peanut one. A very solid spot for small groups going to the Symphony. Food-wise, I'd say their lamb combo for two is a good start.

Pros: Food tasted good and fresh. I also liked that you order through a QR code.

Cons: Portion sizes are definitely way too small for the cost. It‚Äôs actually frustrating thinking about how cheap lentils and that kind of thing are and then looking at the tiny portion. We paid $50 for a shared plate, it could‚Äôve at least been filled full.

Great Ethiopean food, prices reasonable.  Try the Peanut Tea !!
Portions are large.  We had a meal for free and didn't finish it.  Extra bread available.

Delicious food and super thoughtful staff - we had a vegetarian combo for two and lamb combo for two which was more than enough for the four adults eating. Everything is so tasty as well as beautifully presented. I highly recommend eating here!

name: Evidence of Trust: African Wholesale and Retail Store:

reviews.text: Very clean and organized. I love the quality and freshness of the products as well!

Small , but you will get anything here for making African dish. Their prices are actually cheaper than going to the big tropical stores. Very polite and friendly people. The only issue is nobody really knows they are there . They need to advertise. Their products are authentic and cheap. If everybody knows  where they are,  they will skyrock. Highly recommended
Have a lot of desirable items, and variability. The workers are kind, and if there is any load that might be to heavy, like yam, there always ready to help!
Nice store and they have everything you want and the mama there is nice personüòÉ ‚ù§ üòç
Wonderful place with a variety of African goods reminds me of home. üëçüëçüëç

Place had a wonderful Ethiopian vibe with incense and beautiful artwork that set the mood right away. The food was made with quality ingredients‚Ä¶tasty, flavorful, and very authentic. Service was warm and welcoming, and the dishes came out quickly. A great spot to enjoy a genuine Ethiopian experience.

I have mixed feelings about this place...on one hand, the food was solid and the price was relatively cheaper compared to other options nearby. However, the service was a bit slow, and my stomach doesn't feel well afterwards, which could be something I ate there.

Still, the sambusa was solid, and the injera was not too sour, if that's what you prefer.
What a treat! The portions were generous, the prices were reasonable, and the service was kind and efficient. We especially enjoyed the delicious Lega Tibs and mango juice.

Delicious Ethiopian food at good prices. The veggie dishes were generous, but the meat dish had only a few pieces of meat. Service was a bit inattentive, though it‚Äôs a small, family-run place. Still worth checking out for the flavors.
this place is incredible. we got the combo platter for 2, and everything included was perfect. will definitely come back.

Quick friendly service and food was delicious. Please PLEASE try the potato greens..lawd!! They are sooo good. I've gotten snapper fillet both times I've eaten here.. great seasoning and flavor. Be careful with the pepper sauce if you are not experienced with spicy foods!

Couldn‚Äôt even finish the food it was soo nasty!!
Lol jk, this was amazing food. I just moved to MIA from out of town and have been craving Liberian food for sooo long. I was so happy to find this restaurant and try their potato greens. Omg it‚Äôs to die for, and the pepper sauce was excellent. Thank you Fannoh Flavor üíö I can‚Äôt wait to order more food from y‚Äôall

There is no denying that Fannoh is one of the best chefs in South Florida. His portion sizes are HUGE, the food is authentic, and his personality is amazing. Highly recommend the attieke and fish or pepper chicken and the palava sauce with fufu.

My daughter‚Äôs graduation party is coming up and she wanted Liberian food. Reached out to Fannoh Flavor and even though he had to leave town he made sure to get our order made so we would have it for her party that is coming up. Haven‚Äôt tasted Liberian food in years. I appreciate it and so does my belly!

I‚Äôve been struggling to find good authentic African food in the area for a while. So happy I came across Fannoh Food Truck! I ordered their Fufu and Chicken Pepper Soup and it was delicious! Super spicy and the chicken was so flavorful and tender! Everything was so fresh! Will definitely be going back to try more menu items asap! 10/10

Very Nice service. And, very good food. As a Senegalese Liberian, I wasnt expecting less from my Birthland Senegal that has some of the best food West Africa. Thank you Ms Meimouna. I really had a good time coming in today with my Friend. The thieboudienne, bisaap and thiakri were great. So yummy.
I think they just opened and have really yummy take out! The chicken and rice and okra were all delicious and a lot of food for a good price!
I just tried this place and it was really good! Friendly service and the fish dish I had was very tasty.

Positively delightful! It was my first time trying Ethiopian cuisine and our server was friendly and patient with us. Highly recommend the meat and vegetable sampler. It could easily feed 3-4 people. We had the plantains for an appetizer, best plantains I‚Äôve ever had! Also tried the honey wine - I would recommend trying it at least once, comes in a cool glass. We had both the gluten & gluten free injera (bread like food served with the meal) - both were delicious.
Friendly staff, clean restaurant, reasonably priced, very positive experience.

The food was decent, but the overall experience was disappointing. The bathroom was in poor shape ‚Äî no hand soap or paper towels and clearly way overdue for cleaning. Service was very slow even though we were the only table after another group left, and we had to ask several times for basics like water refills and another round of drinks. (I know it's typically a relaxed pace at Ethiopian restaurants, but this was extra slow.) They were also out of several menu items, and despite displaying multiple beers, only one option was available. Lastly, their payment system is sketchy  ‚Äî to pay with a credit card the server had to call someone (perhaps the owner) so we could pay via a link to Square. Wish we‚Äôd been able to go to Lucy‚Äôs, but they‚Äôre closed on Mondays.

Went there a week ago. The place was empty and the lights were off. The waiter/chef stated that they were open. Went with a party of four. The experience was like the twilight zone. No appetizers were available. No soap in the bathroom. The food was okay, however we each received only one injera and then they ran out. The chef stated that they would be receiving more in 15 minutes. We didn't wait and finished our meals. Would never go back.

We've eaten and ordered from here several times and it's been great. Tonight not so much. The tibs were so tough, overcooked, and lacked  flavor. The interaction was stiff and thick, and was thrown into a plastic bag and came broken in bits. The lentils in the vegetable combo were thicker than usual and honestly felt like they reheated an old batch. If we were dining in, I would have sent everything back it was so bad. Really disappointed.

First time having Ethiopian and it was amazing! I could probably eat 20 of their sambusas and the lamb in my dish was so tender. My husband is a spice fiend and he said his dish was the perfect balance of spiciness and flavor. My kids were unimpressed with the offerings but that's on us to broaden their culinary horizons better. Anyway. Staff was very kind to us, I was out of my element so their hospitality was much appreciated. Food was filling and so tasty and I definitely see us returning in the future. Thanks!!

We will drive across town in rush hour traffic to devour Lucy Ethiopian. It is that good. Their shiro is incredible. So many good dishes. Bring your friends and family. Introduce them to incredible food for all to enjoy.

Terrible Experience  Would Never Recommend This was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. From the moment we walked in, the hostess/waitress was extremely rude and unwelcoming. We specifically asked not to be served lamb, yet she brought us lamb anyway. When we politely pointed it out, she responded with a bad attitude instead of apologizing or fixing the mistake.
What made it even worse was that the owner was present the entire time and never once came over to check on us or ask how our food or service was. But as we were leaving, she had the nerve to confront one of our guests instead of addressing the real issue her staff‚Äôs behavior and the overall poor service.
This place should not even be open. It was a huge disappointment from start to finish. I would never go back or recommend it to anyone.

Exceptional restaurant in almost every way. The food is incredible and it was very comfortable to spend a few hours eating with friends and telling jokes. Very easy to order intentionally vegan/vegetarian.

Also reasonably priced for the quality and quantity offered. I will definitely come back again.

The FOOD was amazing! The staff was friendly and happy to explain the dishes. I personally loved the way she poured the food onto the platter. Made it extra special. I loved the Beef tips so much flavor and so juicy! I can‚Äôt wait to come back! Keep up the good work Lucy Ethiopian Restaurant!!!

The worst dining experience I‚Äôve ever had.
We stopped at this restaurant for lunch, hoping for a nice break but instead we were met with rudeness from the staff. As bad as the server was, the owner‚Äôs behavior was even worse and completely unprofessional.

The owner came out and confronted someone from our group over a personal matter, right there in the middle of the restaurant. Instead of handling things privately or focusing on running the business, they chose to make a scene in front of all the customers  something that was both inappropriate and embarrassing.

It was clear the owner had no idea how to separate personal feelings from professional responsibilities. This kind of behavior is unacceptable in any business, let alone a place meant to serve the public. I would never return, and I absolutely do not recommend this place to anyone.

‚ÄúFlavorful‚Äù describes it. This is a very solid example of Ethiopian food (at least as served in the US ‚Äî haven‚Äôt been to Ethiopia itself so no point of comparison). If you‚Äôve been to Ethiopian before you will not be surprised by anything.  The menus all seem to be pretty much the same and this is no exception.  But that‚Äôs not a reason not to go.  It‚Äôs damn delicious.  And, for first timers like my kids, the joy of eating with your hands / injera is something not to be missed.

Delicious Ethiopian food, one of our favorite hidden gems in Denver. Super flavorful, hearty portion sizes, great service, overall an amazing experience. Would definitely recommend checking this restaurant out! The spicy beef stew was a particular favorite.

Holy Moly! This place is incredible and so authentic. I grew up in DC which is known as the epicenter of Ethiopian food. This place is just as good as any of the places in DC and it turns out because they used to own one that my family used to frequent. Run to this place if you want delicious food.

Don‚Äôt worry about Colfax construction, there was enough parking on the side streets that it was a quick walk. Totally worth every step my wife and I took.

This was a meal that we barely spoke during because the food was so incredible we became completely engrossed in the act of eating. It was truly so delicious, the staff were so chill and kind, and I tried to Shazam every song they were playing inside. 10/10. Would eat here weekly if I lived in Denver. This meal felt like a hug.

Amazing experience at this Ethiopian restaurant! As a vegetarian, I loved the variety of flavorful veg dishes, especially the lentils and greens. The injera was fresh and perfectly tangy. The staff was friendly and helpful, making the whole experience even better. Highly recommend for delicious and authentic Ethiopian food!

name: Konjo Ethiopian Food
vicinity: INSIDE of The Edgewater Public Market, 5505 W 20th Ave Suite #106, Edgewater

reviews.text: This is my favorite place to eat within Edgewater Public Market. It‚Äôs a great place to eat for vegan/vegetarians. I always get all 4 veggies and the rolls. Keep in mind the lentils are spicy but good! My husband and I get the 1 plate to share and its plenty
If you have never tried Ethiopian food. I highly recommend this spot. You will not be disappointed. Staff is amazing. Make you feel like family.

I‚Äôve had Konjo dining in and out. Amazing everytime. The food is cooked to perfection everytime. It is so fresh, it hits the spot. I absolutely love bringing friends to the market and ending at Kojo for food. I‚Äôve also bought two plates and meal prepped for the week. The portions are well worth the price. The samosas were top notch, you can‚Äôt go wrong with the lamb or beef plates. I would get at least one extra side of injera if you would like to finish your plate. Two wouldnt even be a stretch. It‚Äôs always incredible, will always come back to Konjo.

4.3 stars. We are huge fans of Ethiopian food so when we found this spot, excited would be an understatement. This is located inside a food hall where there are a plethora of flavors to choose from.

The menu is easy to follow and priced reasonably. Wife ordered the Chicken Tibs Plate ($13.99) with Misir Wot (red lentils). I ordered the Beef Tibs Plate ($14.99) with the Tikel Gomen (curried cabbage). We topped it off with one Sambusa ($4) to split.

There was a brief wait of about 8 or so minutes before our food was ready. Flavors were good though portion size was on the light side. Maybe it was because it was towards the end of the night so supplies were running low?

Employees were busy putting together the orders so interaction was to a minimum. The order setup is via an easy to follow and use touchscreen.

All-in with tip was around $40.  Personally for us, we will opt for a traditional sit down restaurant the next time we are looking for Ethiopian.

Thank you, however, for a good meal with nice flavors.

Konjo is the first place I tried Ethiopian years ago and is still near and dear to my heart. The food is amazing and their 'vegan's delight' lives up to its name. I have to get the lentils and peas every time but it's so hard to choose between the cabbage and potatoes w/spinach. I got to meet the owner as well and she is so kind. Overall, it's refreshing to eat good food somewhere where the workers seem happy and the owner is still a part of our community.

This is not a restaurant but the service and atmosphere are remarkable. I enjoyed every moment. Don Tomas is full of wisdom. He is direct and will not steer you in the wrong direction. I left feeling fulfilled and accomplished. Will definitely be back. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è
Definitely was on point both times I went. Had to send my friends. And affordable!!

This was a nice find on a Saturday. The place is quaint, with about seven tables. The food was amazing. I tried the jollof rice and fried red snapper. That meal did not disappoint. I was so happy that I stopped in. One would argue that the process are steeple. I paid $35 during lunch hours for an authentic west African meal. I have no regrets and will return to try other dishes.

Accessible entrance.

I loved the decor! The food is delightful! The fufu is soft and sticky and soaks up and gravy and tames a bit of the kick and the heat was perfect where it's not over powering. I loved the digital menu board and that it is a simple menu. It's an order at the counter type restaurant. The service was wonderful in my experience. Of course it's a bit hidden in a very mini strip mall off of 19th/Glendale. As they say "hole in the wall restaurants tend to have the best food".

Deceptive practices. I got $70 of food. I order BEEF in my cassava soup with fufu. I noticed I had dry pieces of chicken mix with beef. Food was good but not what I ordered.  Most likely stick with my original spot.
The food and customer service here was amazing! I will definitely be back!

Authentic West African cuisine. Satisfying and reminiscent of homemade dishes.

It's the perfect hole-in-the-wall spot. Yall know what I mean, you come for the bomb*** food, not for any fancy atmosphere or marketing gimmicks that compromises authenticity.

Regarding the comment about microwaving, cooking West African cuisine is time-consuming, prepping earlier in the day can make it more efficient in a restaurant setting. It's far superior to the preserved, shipped frozen food served by franchise restaurants.

Ten stars üåü                                                               beautiful environment, atmosphere and interior design. I can't call it decor because that word does not do justice to the lovely walls that appear to be beautiful wood carvings, nor does the term decor have the esteem to refer to the cultural artifacts thoughtfully placed about - the natural enhancement of lighting , and the comfortable seating areas with clean adorable apolstrty. The food was tasty and served after preparation in a timely manner that compliments the flow of conversation. I think my favorite was the Doro Wat, along with the beets, and the chickpeas, however the cheese was light and creamy and the enjira bread was mellow, tangy, soft to the touch and added the proper balance to the spices and flavors . The absolute highlight and great surprise was the staff! These were the kindest, with pleasant voices, understanding spirits and just incredible Gentleman who took out order and served us. It was as soothing as a spa date to be under their care . One last note my friends, you MUST  treat yourself to the fruit drink...where do I start...it seems to be a fresh puree of sweet tropical fruits layered in glass with various delicies. Each layer of fruit bounces with flavor as you sink your straw in at different levels to find distinct flavors of watermelon , mango etc each like memories of childhood when we played all day outdoors and  fruit was sweet & real. So much better than candy but did remind me a bit of mambas but healthy. The juice in itself could be a meal And worthy of a visit. Please do go, and thx again to the Staff for making this a peaceful wonderful meal. We arrived mid afternoon and left full and happy. Enjoy!

We love this location and are thrilled they are opening in Scottsdale and trying to get into Ahwatukee. Hey landlords of Ahwatukee‚Ä¶.. let these guys in! We love them and need more delicious restaurants around here!!!

The food is delicious and since we are new to Ethiopian cuisine they are always so patient with us as we learn the menu! Huge bonus.

Their coffee is wonderful and we were excited to learn they are opening a coffee shop next door and even a retail shop!!üôå

The restaurant is always clean and the energy is so fun! Lots of families, people out on dates, and good music! We just love it here!!

This place is great, the service is very slow, so don't come in a rush. The food is amazing. Also, pro tip on Sambusas, it is a single Sambusa, no like a plate of them. Also mix their specialty drink before drinking it, its not very sweet until you mix it.

The wings are awesome and the Gluten Free carrot cake is soooo moist and the frosting is perfect. I ate it too fast to take a pic üòÖ.
