Fantastic food, delicious vegan, great service and culture. This is authentic food, be respectful and don‚Äôt go just to try and then realize this isn‚Äôt your type of food. Pay generously!!

Delicious Ethiopian food!
We truly felt welcomed here and had a wonderful meal.
The two person sampler was the perfect size
Looking forward to coming back

My friends and I had such a wonderful time here tonight.  The atmosphere was relaxed, the service was great, and the food was delicious. We all enjoyed the coffee, meat and veggie combo and red wine tremendously. Absolutely recommend this establishment.

Kare has the best Ethiopian food in the valley hands down. I love how chill the atmosphere inside with Ethiopian customers chatting and watching Ethiopian music videos. First I ordered meat sambusas. They are super crispy and the filling is delicious. The sauce is very spicy but delicious. We got the meat & vegetable combo and it was delicious. I love meat but the veggies were super good. Finally I got the traditional Ethiopian coffee and that was so earthy and delicious. It comes with a burning frankincense you can smell while drinking the coffee. We hung out there for a while after dinner and had a few glasses of Ethiopian wine. They also sell spices and coffee products I feel like I must return and buy some Berbere spices.

Kare is the real deal. The taste of love is in every morsel that exits the kitchen. My wife and I have been here numerous times now and it has always been consistently fantastic. The Ethiopian coffee set definitely creates an experience and enhances things beautifully before the main course is served. Both meat and veggie options are absolutely phenomenal. We have never left feeling anything other than completely stuffed and immensely satisfied. Enjoy!
We  loved Kare! The owners were so warm and made us feel right at home. Every bite was flavorful and made with so much care. Highly recommend!
This is by far our favorite Ethiopian Restaurant.The flavors are incredible and the people who own it are so kind! This is the best in the valley no question.

name: Abyssinia Restaurant and Cafe Ethiopian Cuisine

reviews.text: Azi was super friendly the owner! Food was fresh and delicious üòã honey wine was good as well, most of all I loved her coffee ‚òïÔ∏è she offered it for free which i thought was very sweet of her, Thank you Azi for being so friendly and nice to our family and kids. God bless you üôè‚ù§Ô∏è
The food was great. Traditionally prepared and served. The waitstaff were friendly and accommodating. I'll be back!

The food was amazing! And honestly very well priced we ordered the veggie signature dish, 2 meat dishes and sambusas and it was very affordable. Everything was SOO flavorful!
The service was great! Our waitress was very kind and super helpful !
The restaurant itself was very cozy, authentic decor, and I enjoyed being able to have our own private area to enjoy our food.
Food was delicious and the owner was very kind. Atmosphere was fantastic as well!

This is my number one spot for Ethiopian food in the valley! It‚Äôs become my go to for date nights and girls night. The food is all so good and the service is lovely. You‚Äôre greeted like family when you walk in. The atmosphere is dim and full of inviting scents. Definitely try the ceremony coffee while you‚Äôre there!!

I‚Äôve been eating at First Cup Ethiopian Restaurant on and off for over five years, and every single time it‚Äôs been an incredible experience. The food is always of excellent quality‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and consistently prepared with care. That consistency is rare to find, and it‚Äôs one of the main reasons I keep coming back.
The service is outstanding. The team here greets me warmly every visit, and what touches me the most is the love and compassion they extend‚Äîwelcoming me barefoot without judgment. That level of respect and kindness goes far beyond food; it‚Äôs a reflection of their beautiful spirit.
If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant where the food is always top-notch, the service is heartfelt, and the atmosphere feels like home, this is the place.
Love and ((HUGS)),
Laura Foster
Founder, Souls Healing Humanity

A True Taste of Ethiopia in Arizona!

From the moment I stepped inside, I was greeted with the warm, welcoming hospitality that Ethiopian culture is known for. The restaurant‚Äôs atmosphere is cozy yet vibrant, with traditional music and beautiful d√©cor that instantly transports you to Addis Ababa.

The food was absolutely outstanding. The injera was soft, fresh, and perfectly tangy, and the variety of wot dishes was a flavorful journey‚Äîeach stew rich in spices and depth. The doro wot was tender and savory, with just the right amount of heat, and the misir wot had that comforting, earthy taste that makes you want to keep eating long after you‚Äôre full. Vegetarians and meat lovers alike will find something to love here.

What truly sets this place apart is the care and authenticity in every bite. You can tell the recipes are made with love and passed down through generations. The coffee ceremony was a beautiful experience‚Äînot just a drink, but a cultural ritual, filling the air with the rich aroma of freshly roasted beans.

Whether you‚Äôre new to Ethiopian cuisine or a lifelong fan, this restaurant is a must-visit. It‚Äôs more than just a meal‚Äîit‚Äôs a cultural experience you‚Äôll remember and want to share with friends and family.

The  Doro Wot plate was so delicious, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The unique spyce flavor is amazing. The prices are reasonable and Mr Tamrat (Owner) treated me like family. I highly recommend First Cup Ethiopian Restaurant to anyone looking for a great Ethiopian Food or coffee.

Second time here, and I'll definitely be back. Excellent food and service. As I am not Ethiopian, I don't know much about the food or what is customary, but the Lady here was very nice and answered all the questions I had. I had a vegetarian plate, and I am not leaving hungry. Thank you First Cup.

My wife lived in Ethiopia for a couple months and she misses it there so I took her here. We both loved the platter we got and experienced the owners sweet and kind hospitality. Can‚Äôt wait to return soon.

The food at Gojo Ethiopian was very good ‚Äì we tried the Gojo Combo, Meat Combo, Meat & Veggie Combo, and also ordered Doro Wot. Everything tasted authentic and flavorful.

However, the service needs improvement. There was only one server for the whole restaurant, and we had to ask for basic things like water glasses. The portion sizes also felt too small for the price. For example, the Doro Wot was $14 but came with only one piece of chicken and one egg, which didn‚Äôt feel worth it.

Overall, delicious food but service and portion sizes could be much better.

A restaurant with a truly interesting atmosphere, uniquely designed to offer an authentic Ethiopian experience. The food, prepared by an Ethiopian lady chef, had a genuine homemade taste rich in tradition and flavor. A wonderful place to visit and enjoy a memorable meal.

This place deserves more love! Stopped by for lunch on a Friday. The mixed veggie & meat platter was delicious and affordable - I stuffed myself and ate the whole thing by myself, but it was enough food for two people to split. The injeera bread in particular was perfect. The decor is really cool and our server was friendly.

Owner is super friendly! Felt welcomed Great customer service. First time here and we enjoyed our dinner, if you've never tried ethiopian food definitely come here the food tasted very authentic and you might like it!! We tried their honey wine it was super good üëå
Injera bread was delicious!
Owner said his wife did all the cooking and she did really good! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüëç
My toddler is 2 years old and he loved the injera bread!! Toddler approved üëåüòÅ

I ordered to go, and really enjoyed the meal
I look forward to going back to explore more of their menu

name: Calabash African Kitchen
vicinity: 1750 S Rainbow Blvd Suite 6-8, Las Vegas

reviews.text: This was our first time eating African food and it was amazing. The food portions are very generous. The waiter Isaiah was very attentive and even brought us samples of the stews as he senses we'd never had African food...such a thoughtful detail. The taste of everything was amazingly fresh and flavorful. Their juices were also fresh and very good. There was a live musician and the decor was nice and the way that the tables are setup felt very spacious, we weren't bumping into anyone. Just a really nice experience overall. Definitely recommend

Such a fun experience! Our waiter was so kind and inviting and even gave us samples to help us decide what we liked and wanted to order as this was our first time. Food and drinks were so delicious!! Great music and overall dining! Highly recommend!!

The service and server were great, really friendly and actually gave samples. I couldn‚Äôt recommend the place more. We came with our family for my wife‚Äôs birthday and she loved it. The food was really good and it has many different options from the region. Would go back and recommend we went for lunch, but it looks like dinner and maybe some certain nights are more happening.

My experience at calabash was 8/10
The food was good and the service was really good too. I went there with my friends that come from Swiss for a work conference and they loved all the food. The only thing for me they sells empty jellof rice for $21 and sell meats separately $8 or so while on the menu they are vegetables and fish or meat but when it served it some how different. Too pricey. I recommend this place. Have lots of money in the bank lol

My sister and I really enjoyed Calabash. The ladies inside were nice, cool, and down to earth. The food was fresh, hot, tasty, and flavorful. I really enjoyed the Fufu and Oxtail stew! The ginger pineapple juice was top tier!! The vibes-energy in the atmosphere was good; the music too. The next time I‚Äôm in Vegas I will be back. This restaurant is OFF the strip, but not far. Google maps got us there, but when you get close, it‚Äôs in a plaza look carefully for the plaza as you get close.

name: Nigerian Cuisine by MJ

reviews.text: This is the worst nigerian food I have ever ordered. First of all the food cost $250 for only 4 plates of food, plus $25 for tax and $20 for delivery. The food took almost 3 hours to be delivered and then when the food finally arrived, every single item was terrible. Even the plantain tasted so bad. How can anyone mess up fried plantain!!!!!!!. The reviews are either lying or they don‚Äôt know what Nigerian food should taste like. Just look at the beans and the yam porridge, the food was not completely cooked. DON‚ÄôT ORDER FOOD FROM HERE
Horrible Nigerian food experience in Las Vegas!!! We paid over $80 for the meals we order and waited over an hour before food arrives. No meat on the food!!! Do not waste your money at this place.

Worst place to order food! This was an order $25 meat soup. Ordered delivery order. When I called they are said  ' it was to be picked up'  yet I was charged a delivery fee. Finaly pictured that is what was delivered $25. The soup was all in the bag and had to put back in the bowl. No pounded yam as expected. I tried calling several times nothing. DO NOT ORDER!
It should be all Zero though no option for zero
Great place for authentic Nigerian food. Highly recommended üëåüèΩ

This place is a scam and ripping people off. DO NOT GO HERE! Listen to all these reviews. We wanted some Nigerian food while traveling and paid $70 for two jollof rice with plantains and goat meat. We each got 1 piece of goat meat and 3 pieces of cow skin or a chicken wing. Prices are also wrong on the menu, they will charge you 50% more than listed.

name: Nigerian Food
vicinity: 953 E Sahara Ave E-22, Las Vegas

reviews.text: Amazing Nigerian food, and if you haven't had it before she will help guide you.  Get off the Strip and come eat fantastic food!  Call ahead if you're in a hurry, all food is made fresh.  Homemade style.

I had a truly disappointing experience with the owner‚Äôs service. Her rudeness and lack of basic customer service skills were shocking. After we were told to expect a 55-minute wait, we were informed via text over an hour later that our food was ready. The kicker? She expected us to arrive in just 2 minutes, despite it being already 7:55 PM!

When we explained that our Uber was on the way, she had the audacity to question why she should wait for us. Seriously? She claimed to be a pharmacy, but that doesn‚Äôt excuse her unprofessional behavior. To top it all off, her own business hours on Google clearly state that they close at 9:00 PM!

This experience was not just frustrating; it was infuriating. Customer service should be a priority, and this encounter proved otherwise. I won‚Äôt be returning.

Food was magically delicious!! If you want authentic Nigerian cuisine, then lol no further. Whenever I travel I always look for a Nigerian restaurant to try and besides me going to Nigeria last year, this is as fresh and authentic as it gets. With it being made fresh, it will take more time to
Prepare but it‚Äôs worth it and very professional

I won't say I'm the best person to review Nigerian food. This is only the second place I've had Nigerian food and the other was in California. The food was tasty to me but very pricey therefore I don'tknow if I'll be able to eat it often. I liked the egusi though level 3 was not spicy enough for me. My husband got the jollof rice with mixed meat which he said was a bit tough and the rice a bit too wet. The flavor was good though. The staff was friendly and the decor could be updated a bit but I don't mind those things as much as food.

This is by far, the worst restaurant I‚Äôve been to. The audacity for the owner to tell me, she doesn‚Äôt cater to Africans because we give her issues, and her target audience is white people only coz I asked to know how much longer my food will take after being told 15 minutes by her assistant; 35 mins later, she came back to ask what protein I wanted and that she‚Äôs just about to start making my food and that her food takes 45 mins after ordering.

Furthermore, she wanted extra amount for protein quite different from what is listed on the menu to bring my total to $42 for just a plate of jollof rice! When I asked why, she retorted ‚ÄúVegas is expensive‚Äù

The food was wack with too much seasoning which did upset my stomach, the meat tasted stale. I guess she‚Äôs focused on attracting white customers only in the hope that they are not familiar with how much an African food should cost and how it should taste. For anyone in doubt, try other African restaurants, our food is so much better and cost half of her price.
Excellent and perfect Nigerian African touch food, prepared while you wait and play African games. Place to visit.
It‚Äôs really Indians and the restaurant is a cover up!! Be safe y‚Äôal
If you're looking for that great home cooked African food, this is your place. Try it..
A little small and maybe no for everyone but nice food

This restaurant should not exist at all, I was on a vacation in Vegas, and the moment I came in town, I decided to check if there's an African Restaurant on doordash, and bang this restaurant pop up without me looking at the review, I placed an order for a 2 jollof rice, 1 for rounded and egunsi, and a plate of pepper soup  , spending over 116$, jollof rice doesn't even taste like a restaurant jollof rice, the moment I ordered on doordash, I realized they didn't ask me for the option of protein on my food, I called the restaurant and a guy picked up,  and after I explained the situation he got my order and told me I ordered 2 sides of jollof rice and it doesn't come with meat, at the end of the call, he said I will throw some goat meat in there buddy and dude hung up, I got my order and it was a mess, the pounded yam doesn't even taste like pounded yam, either flower or pounded, the egunsi was all white , no sign of vegetable what so ever in it, I manage to eat the pounded yam but trust me, I had food poisoning for the first 3 days of my vacation,  I tried leaving feedback on doordash but for whatever reason it didn't let me  ,saying I can't get refund. Talk about the pepper soup,  I don't even know what to describe it with , I couldn't eat it at all. Cocos restaurant,  you guys are not representing African restaurants well at all.

The owner responded to my review talking about i ordered side of Jollof rice does not come with protein, I did not order side of Jollof Rice, I ordered 2 plates of Jollof rice, and i paid 30$ each, so both rice i paid 60$, is your side of Jollof rice 60$? what about the fact that your food gave me food poison???? did you read about that in in my review? why not address that part?

Why not allow me to reply to your response? why do i only have one option to delete my review?? this is so unfair and you are just selling rubbish to your customers, especially those that are not from Africa, who dont even know what it looks or taste like.

I am trying to upload the receipt for my order but for some reasons wont let me.

JUST CHANGE THE QUALITY OF FOOD YOU ARE COOKING FOR PEOPLE TO EAT TO THE BEST. when people order from the restaurants its not that they cant cook at home, they sometimes just want a better taste than what they are use to.

if you get a chance to read my review before eating here, please don't go there if you don't want to damage your health.

Coco African kitchen meals are  so delicious and much better than homemade delicacies. I have dined there a couple of friends, ordered as well. They service was exceptionally great .I order their foods to be delivered out of state. Their prices are sooo√≤ reasonable .
The beef patties were sooooo good! And the plantains were perfect. Definitely a must try

CoCo‚Äôs African Kitchen is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. It is absolutely outstanding! From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with warmth and hospitality that makes you feel right at home. Truly a home away from home! If you‚Äôre looking for a place that serves outstanding food in a warm and vibrant setting, look no further. I highly recommend CoCo‚Äôs African Kitchen to anyone in Texas (and beyond). Once you try it, you‚Äôll definitely keep coming back!

name: Las Gidi Nigerian African Foods
vicinity: Westlake Center, 4529 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas

reviews.text:
My wife ordered egusi soup from this restaurant to surprise me, since she knows how much I love it. The result? Pure disappointment‚Äîand serious concern. The soup was nothing but salt, no authentic flavor at all. When my wife called to complain, the owner openly admitted he loads it with Maggi and salt because, in his words, ‚Äúpeople in Las Vegas like spices.‚Äù That is reckless and dangerous. Excessive sodium and artificial seasoning at that level isn‚Äôt just bad cooking‚Äîit poses real health risks, including high blood pressure, kidney damage, heart disease, and long-term organ strain.

This is not food‚Äîit‚Äôs poison disguised as a meal. The owner even said ‚Äúit‚Äôs all about business.‚Äù That tells you everything. Please, do not order from here. For the sake of your health, your family‚Äôs health, and the community‚Äôs safety, this place needs to be reported to public health immediately.

‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: This is a serious risk to human health. Be careful and stay away.

Ordered on DoorDash, food took twice as long to come because they had the door locked. Certain items on the menu weren‚Äôt available but overall, the food was pretty good. Fried rice and plantains were delicious but the soup swallow was really watered down. The meat was terrible, not as advertised. Fried rice was supposed to come with meat, but didn‚Äôt have any. By the time we got to us, it had leaked all over the bag as well, terrible packaging.

üö® ABSOLUTELY THE WORST PLACE EVER ‚Äì RUN AWAY!!! üö®

This so-called restaurant is an embarrassment to food, hospitality, and basic human decency. The food is disgusting beyond words. Overloaded with salt and Maggi until it tastes like punishment, not a meal, the owner literallytold me he loaded it with Maggi. Every bite felt like they were daring me to keep eating, and the worst part? They serve it with zero remorse, like they know it‚Äôs trash and don‚Äôt care.

The customer service? A total disaster. Rude, careless, and offensive.  The owner himself is the crown jewel of the nonsense ‚Äî arrogant, unprofessional, and flat-out disrespectful. He had the audacity to say he doesn‚Äôt like Nigerians because ‚Äúthey complain.‚Äù Excuse me? People complain because your food is HORRIBLE, your service is HORRIBLE, and your attitude is even worse.

This isn‚Äôt just a bad restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a health hazard, a scam, and a shame all rolled into one. If you value your health, your money, or even the tiniest bit of self-respect, avoid this place like the plague. Don‚Äôt walk away ‚Äî RUN.

Listen, for those of you saying disregard the reviews and try them out, you better don‚Äôt fall for these scammers. You order food, wait more than 3 hours after the time agreed for them to deliver. They eventually cooked up a story that the delivery driver ran off with the food and does not want to refund. Order from them at your own risk!

THE ABSOLUTE WORST‚Äîfood and service alike. I ordered two plates of spicy noodles, asun, and chicken suya, and beef kebab, but I received soggy, salty noodles (both portions served on one plate), and it looked disgusting! They even added shrimp, which I didn‚Äôt ask for, with no regard for allergies. We also never received the beef kebab.

By the way, the asun was basically three tiny pieces of goat meat drowned in lots of veggies and oil. When I called to express my displeasure, the man had the audacity to tell me the plate was big enough for two portions, so there was no need for two plates. He added that it‚Äôs only Nigerians who complain, well, he‚Äôs absolutely right because we know what the food should taste like! He also tried to play the ‚ÄúI have people your age at home‚Äù card, which goes to show the deep level of unprofessionalism.

No apologies were rendered, the worst customer service, crowned by the mediocrity of a Nigerian man trying to prove a point when he‚Äôs clearly wrong.

name: Gursha Ethiopian Restaurant
vicinity: 3711 S Valley View Blvd suit H, Las Vegas

reviews.text:
First time trying this cuisine and wow! Splendid! Mimi was a sweetheart and cooked the meal entirely by herself from scratch all while teaching us about the food. It was great, Thank you Mimi!!

Highly recommend for people who have never tried Ethiopian before - step outside your comfort zone for a wonderful meal at a local business :)

Simple and quiet inside.

Mimi extended very warm hospitality.

It was our first time having Ethiopian food and what a good place to experience it for the first time.

We shared a veg platter and golden beef tips. All the veg was absolutely delicious.

We finished with tiramisu which was also good, Mimi picked it out for us. Absolutely suggest checking it out.

Was here on business and a colleague suggested we try something different - I had never had Ethiopian yet he had. So glad we came out here; the food was fantastic and Amy was delightful. Not licensed but offie next door. BOYB. Great value and great food (the saving will cover an Uber each way too). Do visit :)

The best Ethiopian restaurant I've eaten at. The Doro Wat was amazing, and their vegetable platter. Also loved their Gursha Shekela Tib (picture attached). Reminiscent of Mexican Fajitas with middle eastern flavors. Absolutely amazing! The hostess is also lovely and super friendly. Highly recommend.
I love Ethiopian food & hadn't tried this place until today! The service was great& the food was excellent.

name: V ETHIOPIAN RESTAURANT AND HOOKAH LOUNGE
vicinity: 4230 S Decatur Blvd Suite 200, Las Vegas

reviews.text: We had an incredible experience at this Ethiopian restaurant! The food was absolutely amazing‚Äîflavorful, authentic, and beautifully presented. Every dish felt thoughtfully prepared, and the injera was perfectly spongy and fresh. Our waiter Micky was also fantastic‚Äîvery knowledgeable, friendly, and clearly passionate about the cuisine. You could tell he took pride in the food and service, which made the meal even more enjoyable. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon!

It's a scene here late at night for bar, DJ, hookah time? Local vegas vibes, meaning everyone comes here with their own posse. Tables is the way to go, and order drinks and your hookah at the bar. Very casually run, mom and pop style? After midnight, maybe closer to 130am or 2am is when the place gets crowded. I visited only once in 9/2024 and thought it was an underground type of venue with no sign, or such?

Someone mentioned it's difficult to be a DJ here. The DJ needs to play a bit of everything, because there's like 16 different countries worth of people just there at night. The music jumps around so much, it's difficult to get into it. Everyone is just waiting for their genre, dance and then sit back down. Music is loud. No EDM, thank goodness.

I've only been once and everyone was welcoming. Attire is casual to dressed loungey. I've only been once, and I was the only non- Black, African descent, Islander/Caribbean looking person there. Everyone was nice and didn't stare in a certain way like how I was stared at in Arizona or even parts of Vegas (....like Stoneys Rockin Country).

I love  Ethiopian food. They also have a bar,  hookah lounge all in one plaza. Same owner. By the way the owner is laid-back very friendly. I have tried also the hookahs. No complain. Not far from China town
I LOVE IT HERE ..... THE FOOD IS AMAZING AND THE VIBE FEELS LIKE HOME THANK YOU MICKEY FOR COMIN SHORT NOTICE.....YOU ARE APPRECIATED..... CANT WAIT TO TRY YOUR SHRIMP MOJO üòã

Amazing food! Micky was the best, he explained the menu and gave us recommendations. He made us feel like we‚Äôre at home when we are miles away from our actual home. To be honest this is hands down the best Ethiopian food I‚Äôve had to date. Superb!

My husband wanted to try something ‚Äúnew‚Äù üôÇ
I‚Äôve eaten the food before but not at this location. It was delicious!
We ordered 1 meat combo, 1 meat and veggie combo and 1 veggie combo. If we would have ordered to combo platters it would have been enough for the 4 of us.

If you love Ethiopian food, then I have a word for you. Authentic! Authentic! Authentic! Everything about this place was authentic, from the atmosphere, to the food, to the people.

The portion sizes were incredible. Either go there starving or take a friend with you, because you won't be able to finish it on your own. You'll end up having the leftovers üòã that will feed you for two other meals, like it did me.

And did I mention that this place is vegetarian friendly? I got the veggie combo. It came with spinach, salad, beets, cabbage, and two different kinds of lentils. Amazing! You some won't be disappointed.

reviews.author_name: Green Sea Shells Mag: Wellness by KK
reviews.text:
If you‚Äôre in Las Vegas and craving Ethiopian cuisine, Lucy Ethiopian Restaurant is a decent choice. Tucked away in a quieter neighborhood just off the Strip, it‚Äôs easy to find with plenty of parking. We discovered it thanks to our Eritrean cab driver, who highly recommended it.

We ordered a veggie combo and two samosas, which were the perfect portions for our family of three. The food had a home-style touch, satisfying without feeling heavy‚Äîsomething we appreciated. The service was surprisingly quick, especially for an Ethiopian restaurant, and the staff was warm and welcoming.

That said, there‚Äôs room for improvement. The women‚Äôs restroom was clogged during our visit, and while the flavors were enjoyable, they could have been a bit more complex. As someone who regularly cooks Ethiopian food and has dined at nearly every Ethiopian restaurant in NYC and Los Angeles, I‚Äôd say Lucy is a good option if you‚Äôre craving hearty vegetarian dishes or Ethiopian fare in Las Vegas.

Authentic and delicious meal. The service was fabulous. We had an attentive and kind server and were checked on frequently but never felt rushed. An enjoyable dining experience. We had the vegetable combination platter and meat combination platter and coffee after dinner.  It was more than enough for dinner,  even with three hungry teenage boys. We left full and content. We will be back!

The food here is delicious and generously portioned, and our waitress was very attentive! We got the meat and veggie combo platters (at the recommendation of our waitress), and for 4 people it was the perfect amount of food. The traditional coffee is very smooth but it's pretty strong! I would highly recommend getting it, you're missing out if you skip it. The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere, if I'm ever back in Vegas I will stop by again!
